persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.reason: Central figure in sex trafficking investigation. Convicted in 2008 on state charges, arrested in 2019 on federal charges.
persons.details: Financier and convicted sex offender. Operated a network involving properties in New York, Palm Beach, New Mexico, and the US Virgin Islands. Died by suicide in jail in August 2019 while awaiting trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.reason: Recruited and groomed underage victims for Epstein. Convicted in 2021 on five federal charges including sex trafficking of a minor.
persons.details: Longtime associate of Epstein. Sentenced to 20 years in prison in 2022. Currently serving sentence in federal prison.

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.reason: Modeling agent accused of supplying girls to Epstein. Named in documents and flight logs.
persons.details: French modeling scout charged with rape in France. Died by suicide in jail in 2022 while awaiting trial.

persons.name: Sarah Kellen
persons.reason: Allegedly scheduled massages and managed victim interactions. Frequently mentioned in victim testimonies.
persons.details: Worked closely with Epstein and Maxwell. Granted immunity in 2008 Florida deal but named in later civil suits.

persons.name: Nadia Marcinkova
persons.reason: Allegedly participated in abuse and recruited victims. Frequent passenger on flights.
persons.details: Brought to the US by Epstein as a teenager. Granted immunity in 2008 but accused in civil cases.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.reason: Accused of sexual assault by Virginia Giuffre. Settled civil suit in 2022. Multiple visits to Epstein properties.
persons.details: Former Duke of York. Stripped of royal titles in 2022. Denies wrongdoing.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.reason: Flew on Epstein's plane multiple times. Mentioned in depositions and emails.
persons.details: Former US President. Traveled with Epstein for humanitarian work. Denies knowledge of crimes.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.reason: Socialized with Epstein in the 1990s-2000s. Flew on plane several times. Mentioned in files.
persons.details: Former US President. Publicly distanced himself after 2008 conviction. Denies wrongdoing.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.reason: Epstein's lawyer in 2008 plea deal. Accused by Giuffre of abuse (later retracted).
persons.details: Harvard law professor. Settled civil suits. Denies all allegations.

persons.name: Bill Gates
persons.reason: Met with Epstein multiple times post-conviction for philanthropy discussions.
persons.details: Microsoft co-founder. Regrets association. No accusations of wrongdoing.

persons.name: Elon Musk
persons.reason: Email correspondence about travel. Denies visiting island.
persons.details: Tesla and SpaceX CEO. Mentioned in files but denies close ties.

persons.name: Michael Jackson
persons.reason: Visited Epstein's Palm Beach home according to testimony.
persons.details: Pop star. No accusations of wrongdoing in Epstein case. Died in 2009.

persons.name: David Copperfield
persons.reason: Mentioned in depositions as having been at Epstein's home.
persons.details: Magician. No accusations of wrongdoing.

persons.name: Woody Allen
persons.reason: Regular guest at Epstein's townhouse post-2010. Photographs and emails released in 2025 show social ties.
persons.details: Filmmaker. Helped by Epstein with college admission for daughter. Denies knowledge of crimes.

persons.name: Cameron Diaz
persons.reason: Mentioned by accuser as name-dropped by Epstein. No direct involvement.
persons.details: Actress. Denies any association with Epstein.

persons.name: Leonardo DiCaprio
persons.reason: Mentioned in records as a contact. No evidence of meetings or involvement.
persons.details: Actor. No accusations of wrongdoing.

persons.name: Naomi Campbell
persons.reason: Named in contact book and mentioned in files. Attended events.
persons.details: Model. Denies knowledge of Epstein's crimes.

persons.name: Mick Jagger
persons.reason: Photographed with Epstein and mentioned in files.
persons.details: Musician. No suggestion of involvement in crimes.

persons.name: Chris Tucker
persons.reason: Flew on Epstein's plane for humanitarian trip. Mentioned in documents.
persons.details: Actor. Denies knowledge of wrongdoing.

persons.name: Alec Baldwin
persons.reason: Listed in Epstein's contact book released in 2025.
persons.details: Actor. No accusations of involvement.

persons.name: Ehud Barak
persons.reason: Former Israeli PM mentioned in court documents and visited properties.
persons.details: Politician. Denies any wrongdoing.

persons.name: Howard Lutnick
persons.reason: Limited interactions mentioned in emails. No wrongdoing accused.
persons.details: Businessman. Photographed with Epstein.

persons.name: Larry Summers
persons.reason: Economist with correspondence and meetings post-conviction.
persons.details: Former Treasury Secretary. No accusations.

evidence.label: COURT FILINGS
evidence.name: Unsealed Court Documents
evidence.notes: Documents from Giuffre v. Maxwell lawsuit unsealed in 2024, naming associates.

evidence.label: FLIGHT LOGS
evidence.name: Private Jet Passenger Manifests
evidence.notes: Logs showing passengers on Epstein's planes, including multiple trips by prominent figures.

evidence.label: FINANCIAL RECORDS
evidence.name: Bank and Corporate Documents
evidence.notes: Transactions and shell companies linked to Epstein's operations.

evidence.label: TIMELINE
evidence.text: 1990s-2000s: Peak activity. 2008: Florida plea deal. 2019: Federal arrest and death. 2021: Maxwell conviction. 2024-2026: Document releases.
